content.text: 14% of this amount is deducted for tax and insurance
Calculate the amount of rent he pays
Kasem spends $480 each month on food, entertainment and clothes
He shares this in the ratio
Calculate how much he spends on food each month
Kasem saves the rest of his money
Work out the amount he saves as a percentage of \(\) 774
the lowest common multiple of 8 and 10,
From this list of numbers, write down
Find the smallest factor, apart from 1, of 2013
Write 2013 as the product of its prime factors
Write down the order of rotational symmetry of shape \(A\)
Describe fully the **single** transformation which maps shape \(A\) onto shape \(B\)
Rotate shape \(A\) through \(90^{\circ}\) clockwise about the origin
Enlarge triangle \(LMN\) by scale factor 3 from the centre \(P\)
Write down the length of the base, \(LM,\) and the height of triangle \(LMN.\)
Find the area of the enlarged triangle
Triangle \(LMN\) is drawn on the \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^2\) grid below
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = x^{2} - 2x - 1\) for \(-3 \leqslant x \leqslant 4.\)
The table shows some values of \(y = x^{2} - 2x - 1.\)
Write down the equation of the line of symmetry of the graph
Write down the co-ordinates of two other points on this line
On the grid, draw the line \(y = -x + 4\) for \(-3 \leqslant x \leqslant 4\)
Use both graphs to find the solutions of the equation \(x^{2} - 2x - 1 = -x + 4\)
The point with co-ordinates \((- 3, 7)\) lies on the line \(y = -x + 4\)
Work out the distance in kilometres from \(A\) to \(B\)
Saraswati takes 1 hour 30 minutes to drive from \(A\) to \(B\)
Calculate her average speed, in kilometres per hour, for this journey
The diagram shows four towns, \(A\), \(B\), \(C\) and \(D\), joined by straight roads \(AB\), \(BC\) and \(BD\)
The scale is 1 centimetre represents 12 kilometres
At \(B\), Saraswati follows another straight road which is equidistant from \(BC\) and \(BD\)
Using a straight edge and compasses only and leaving in all your construction lines, construct the line of this road on the diagram
Another motorist, Leah, leaves \(C\) and drives on a bearing of \(165^{\circ}\) to meet Saraswati at town \(E\). Town \(E\) is on the road in **part (b)**
Show Leah's journey on the diagram and mark the town \(E\)
Saraswati travelled from \(B\) to \(E\) at an average speed of \(55\mathrm{km / h}\)
Calculate the time, in hours and minutes, that she took
There is a speed limit of \(50\mathrm{km / h}\) on all roads within \(30\mathrm{km}\) of town \(D\)
On the diagram, show the boundary of the region where this speed limit applies
Complete the frequency table to show all his results
Write down the relative frequency of a total of 5
Complete this table showing how different totals can be made when rolling two dice
Explain why 7 is the most likely total
Felix rolls two fair dice, each numbered from 1 to 6, and adds the numbers shown
He repeats the experiment 70 times and records the results in a frequency table
The first 60 results are shown in the tally column of the table
Write down the mathematical name of the quadrilateral \(ABCD\)
Use trigonometry to show that \(h = 5.2 \text{cm}\), correct to 1 decimal place
Calculate the area of the quadrilateral \(ABCD\)
The quadrilateral forms the cross section of a prism with length 6.8 cm
Calculate the volume of the prism
Give your answer correct to 2 significant figures
In the quadrilateral \(ABCD\), \(BC\) is parallel to \(AD\)
The height of the quadrilateral is \(h\)
Find the values of \(w, x\) and \(y\)
The sum of the angles of a pentagon is \(540^{\circ}\)
A straight line, parallel to \(ED\), passes through the vertex \(C\)
Calculate the value of \(s\) when \(u = 27\), \(a = -2\) and \(t = 15\)
Make \(t\) the subject of the formula \(s = u + at\)
Write down the next term and the rule for finding the next term for the following sequence
Write down the next two terms of this sequence
Write down the \(n\)th term of this sequence
